page.title: 01SUMMARY OF BALFRON AREA
page.content: Balfron (population c.1500) is situated some 15km east of Loch Lomond in{West Central Scotland.}The village is on a south facing slope, looking towards the Campsie Fells and is equidistant from Glasgow and Stirling (approximately 30km). The name Balfron originates from {Balfruin- village of sorrow.}Legend has it, that one day when the villagers were away from home, wolves came down from the hills and devoured the children. Nowadays many villagers describe Balfron as quiet, peaceful and unspoilt. They also remark on the friendliness of the people. The main services for the area are centred in Balfron which could also be described as a{"dormitory village"}for Glasgow. The main industries are rural ones like agriculture and tourism.
